CSCI P-14110 Introduction to Programming, Computational Science, and Data Visualization

This is the course website CSCI P-14110

Lesson 9 - Viz for the web with Sketchfab

NOTE: BRING PHONE + PHONE CHARGER TOMORROW

Today we’ll think about how to share 3D interactive movies on the web.

Make sure you download:

  1. The Planet Files - shapes and surfaces and save them to a specific directory. This includes the library needed to make geometry files from your simulations.
  2. You’ll want to also download Meshlab for testing purposes.

Also: Sign up for your Sketchfab Account

Don’t forget to sign up right here to be able to upload models.

If you want to use VR today tomorrow:

  • Check out the google cardboard instructions on Sketchfab and also learn about how to navigate around your scene.

More Resources

For planet models:

  • Think your planet looks different than one of the ones you downloaded? Check out whats available on google image search.
  • If you want to change the colors of a planet texture or modify it in any way for any reason you can check out this notebook with some simple examples, also listed in the Materials section.

For galaxy models:

  • Check out this notebook to generate a PLY file to upload to Sketchfab, also listed in the Materials section.
  • If you want try this out but don’t want to spend the time to run the models you can download some saved files from a simulation right here that includes dark matter and star particles. Make sure you unzip!
  • Also download this Python library here to be able to read in this dataset.

Bonus: Try with this larger dataset with many different particle types. Again, parsing this harder dataset is left up to you!

Materials

  • Notebook extraNotebook_changingTextureColors_lesson09: (view, download)
  • Notebook extraNotebook_exportingGalaxyData_lesson09: (view, download)
